description: Searches over a website or collection of websites
title: Custom Search API

dateRestrict.description:
Restricts results to URLs based on date. Supported values include:

* `d[number]`: requests results from the specified number of past days.

* `w[number]`: requests results from the specified number of past weeks.

* `m[number]`: requests results from the specified number of past months.

* `y[number]`: requests results from the specified number of past years.

imgColorType.description:
Returns black and white, grayscale, transparent, or color images.
Acceptable values are:

* `"color"`

* `"gray"`

* `"mono"`: black and white

* `"trans"`: transparent background

filter.description:
Controls turning on or off the duplicate content filter.

* See [Automatic
Filtering](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results#automaticFiltering)
for more information about Google's search results filters. Note that host
crowding filtering applies only to multi-site searches.

* By default, Google applies filtering to all search results to improve the
quality of those results.

Acceptable values are:

* `0`: Turns off duplicate content filter.

* `1`: Turns on duplicate content filter.

safe.description:
Search safety level. Acceptable values are:

* `"active"`: Enables SafeSearch filtering.

* `"off"`: Disables SafeSearch filtering. (default)

siteSearchFilter.description:
Controls whether to include or exclude results from the site named in the
`siteSearch` parameter.

Acceptable values are:

* `"e"`: exclude

* `"i"`: include

sort.description:
The sort expression to apply to the results. The sort parameter specifies
that the results be sorted according to the specified expression i.e. sort
by date.
[Example:
sort=date](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/structured_search#sort-by-attribute).

cr.description:
Restricts search results to documents originating in a particular country.
You may use [Boolean
operators](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results_appendices#booleanOperators)
in the cr parameter's value.

Google Search determines the country of a document by analyzing:

* the top-level domain (TLD) of the document's URL

* the geographic location of the Web server's IP address

See the [Country Parameter
Values](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results_appendices#countryCollections)
page for a list of valid values for this parameter.

searchType.description:
Specifies the search type: `image`. If unspecified, results are limited to
webpages.

Acceptable values are:

* `"image"`: custom image search.

imgDominantColor.description:
Returns images of a specific dominant color. Acceptable values are:

* `"black"`

* `"blue"`

* `"brown"`

* `"gray"`

* `"green"`

* `"orange"`

* `"pink"`

* `"purple"`

* `"red"`

* `"teal"`

* `"white"`

* `"yellow"`

num.description:
Number of search results to return.

* Valid values are integers between 1 and 10, inclusive.

relatedSite.description:
Specifies that all search results should be pages that are related to the
specified URL.

exactTerms.description: Identifies a phrase that all documents in the search results must contain.

c2coff.description:
Enables or disables [Simplified and Traditional Chinese
Search](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results#chineseSearch).

The default value for this parameter is 0 (zero), meaning that the feature
is enabled. Supported values are:

* `1`: Disabled

* `0`: Enabled (default)

orTerms.description:
Provides additional search terms to check for in a document, where each
document in the search results must contain at least one of the additional
search terms.

googlehost.description:
**Deprecated**. Use the `gl` parameter for a similar effect.

The local Google domain (for example, google.com, google.de, or
google.fr) to use to perform the search.

highRange.description:
Specifies the ending value for a search range.

* Use `lowRange` and `highRange` to append an inclusive search range of
`lowRange...highRange` to the query.

excludeTerms.description:
Identifies a word or phrase that should not appear in any documents in the
search results.

imgType.description:
Returns images of a type. Acceptable values are:

* `"clipart"`

* `"face"`

* `"lineart"`

* `"stock"`

* `"photo"`

* `"animated"`

hq.description:
Appends the specified query terms to the query, as if they were combined
with a logical AND operator.

cx.description: The Programmable Search Engine ID to use for this request.

hl.description:
Sets the user interface language.

* Explicitly setting this parameter improves the performance and the
quality of your search results.

* See the [Interface
Languages](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results#wsInterfaceLanguages)
section of [Internationalizing Queries and Results
Presentation](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results#wsInternationalizing)
for more information, and (Supported Interface
Languages)[https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results_appendices#interfaceLanguages]
for a list of supported languages.

gl.description:
Geolocation of end user.

* The `gl` parameter value is a two-letter country code. The `gl` parameter
boosts search results whose country of origin matches the parameter value.
See the [Country
Codes](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results_appendices#countryCodes)
page for a list of valid values.

* Specifying a `gl` parameter value should lead to more relevant results.
This is particularly true for international customers and, even more
specifically, for customers in English- speaking countries other than the
United States.

lowRange.description:
Specifies the starting value for a search range. Use `lowRange` and
`highRange` to append an inclusive search range of `lowRange...highRange`
to the query.

siteSearch.description:
Specifies a given site which should always be included or excluded from
results (see `siteSearchFilter` parameter, below).

imgSize.description:
Returns images of a specified size. Acceptable values are:

* `"huge"`

* `"icon"`

* `"large"`

* `"medium"`

* `"small"`

* `"xlarge"`

* `"xxlarge"`

linkSite.description:
Specifies that all search results should contain a link to a particular
URL.

lr.description:
Restricts the search to documents written in a particular language (e.g.,
`lr=lang_ja`).

Acceptable values are:

* `"lang_ar"`: Arabic

* `"lang_bg"`: Bulgarian

* `"lang_ca"`: Catalan

* `"lang_cs"`: Czech

* `"lang_da"`: Danish

* `"lang_de"`: German

* `"lang_el"`: Greek

* `"lang_en"`: English

* `"lang_es"`: Spanish

* `"lang_et"`: Estonian

* `"lang_fi"`: Finnish

* `"lang_fr"`: French

* `"lang_hr"`: Croatian

* `"lang_hu"`: Hungarian

* `"lang_id"`: Indonesian

* `"lang_is"`: Icelandic

* `"lang_it"`: Italian

* `"lang_iw"`: Hebrew

* `"lang_ja"`: Japanese

* `"lang_ko"`: Korean

* `"lang_lt"`: Lithuanian

* `"lang_lv"`: Latvian

* `"lang_nl"`: Dutch

* `"lang_no"`: Norwegian

* `"lang_pl"`: Polish

* `"lang_pt"`: Portuguese

* `"lang_ro"`: Romanian

* `"lang_ru"`: Russian

* `"lang_sk"`: Slovak

* `"lang_sl"`: Slovenian

* `"lang_sr"`: Serbian

* `"lang_sv"`: Swedish

* `"lang_tr"`: Turkish

* `"lang_zh-CN"`: Chinese (Simplified)

* `"lang_zh-TW"`: Chinese (Traditional)

start.description:
The index of the first result to return. The default number of results per
page is 10, so `&start=11` would start at the top of the second page of
results. **Note**: The JSON API will never return more than 100 results,
even if more than 100 documents match the query, so setting the sum of
`start + num` to a number greater than 100 will produce an error. Also note
that the maximum value for `num` is 10.

fileType.description:
Restricts results to files of a specified extension. A list of file types
indexable by Google can be found in Search Console [Help
Center](https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/35287).

rights.description:
Filters based on licensing. Supported values include: `cc_publicdomain`,
`cc_attribute`, `cc_sharealike`, `cc_noncommercial`, `cc_nonderived` and
combinations of these. See [typical
combinations](https://wiki.creativecommons.org/wiki/CC_Search_integration).

list.description:
Returns metadata about the search performed, metadata about the
engine used for the search, and the search results.

Returns metadata about the search performed, metadata about the
engine used for the search, and the search results. Uses a small set
of url patterns.

gl.description:
Geolocation of end user.

* The `gl` parameter value is a two-letter country code. The `gl` parameter
boosts search results whose country of origin matches the parameter value.
See the [Country
Codes](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results_appendices#countryCodes)
page for a list of valid values.

* Specifying a `gl` parameter value should lead to more relevant results.
This is particularly true for international customers and, even more
specifically, for customers in English- speaking countries other than the
United States.

imgType.description:
Returns images of a type. Acceptable values are:

* `"clipart"`

* `"face"`

* `"lineart"`

* `"stock"`

* `"photo"`

* `"animated"`

webpages.

Acceptable values are:

* `"image"`: custom image search.

* `"trans"`: transparent background

Restricts results to files of a specified extension. A list of file types

search results.

Restricts search results to documents originating in a particular country.

Specifies a given site which should always be included or excluded from

**Deprecated**. Use the `gl` parameter for a similar effect.

The local Google domain (for example, google.com, google.de, or
google.fr) to use to perform the search.

Provides additional search terms to check for in a document, where each
document in the search results must contain at least one of the additional

for more information, and (Supported Interface

for a list of supported languages.

Restricts results to URLs based on date. Supported values include:

* `d[number]`: requests results from the specified number of past days.

* `w[number]`: requests results from the specified number of past weeks.

* `m[number]`: requests results from the specified number of past months.

* `y[number]`: requests results from the specified number of past years.

The index of the first result to return. The default number of results per
page is 10, so `&start=11` would start at the top of the second page of
results. **Note**: The JSON API will never return more than 100 results,
even if more than 100 documents match the query, so setting the sum of
`start + num` to a number greater than 100 will produce an error. Also note

exactTerms.description: Identifies a phrase that all documents in the search results must contain.

rights.description:
Filters based on licensing. Supported values include: `cc_publicdomain`,
`cc_attribute`, `cc_sharealike`, `cc_noncommercial`, `cc_nonderived` and
combinations of these. See [typical
combinations](https://wiki.creativecommons.org/wiki/CC_Search_integration).

linkSite.description:
Specifies that all search results should contain a link to a particular
URL.

c2coff.description:
Enables or disables [Simplified and Traditional Chinese
Search](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results#chineseSearch).

The default value for this parameter is 0 (zero), meaning that the feature
is enabled. Supported values are:

* `1`: Disabled

* `0`: Enabled (default)

filter.description:
Controls turning on or off the duplicate content filter.

* See [Automatic
Filtering](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results#automaticFiltering)
for more information about Google's search results filters. Note that host
crowding filtering applies only to multi-site searches.

* By default, Google applies filtering to all search results to improve the
quality of those results.

Acceptable values are:

* `0`: Turns off duplicate content filter.

* `1`: Turns on duplicate content filter.

siteSearchFilter.description:
Controls whether to include or exclude results from the site named in the
`siteSearch` parameter.

Acceptable values are:

* `"e"`: exclude

* `"i"`: include

relatedSite.description:
Specifies that all search results should be pages that are related to the
specified URL.

num.description:
Number of search results to return.

* Valid values are integers between 1 and 10, inclusive.

hq.description:
Appends the specified query terms to the query, as if they were combined
with a logical AND operator.

lowRange.description:
Specifies the starting value for a search range. Use `lowRange` and
`highRange` to append an inclusive search range of `lowRange...highRange`
to the query.

imgSize.description:
Returns images of a specified size. Acceptable values are:

* `"huge"`

* `"icon"`

* `"large"`

* `"medium"`

* `"small"`

* `"xlarge"`

* `"xxlarge"`

safe.description:
Search safety level. Acceptable values are:

* `"active"`: Enables SafeSearch filtering.

* `"off"`: Disables SafeSearch filtering. (default)

sort.description:
The sort expression to apply to the results. The sort parameter specifies
that the results be sorted according to the specified expression i.e. sort
by date.
[Example:
sort=date](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/structured_search#sort-by-attribute).

highRange.description:
Specifies the ending value for a search range.

* Use `lowRange` and `highRange` to append an inclusive search range of
`lowRange...highRange` to the query.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

htmlTitle.description: The title of the promotion, in HTML.

source.description: URL of the image for this promotion link.

bodyLines.description:
An array of block objects for this promotion. See [Google WebSearch
Protocol
reference](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results)
for more information.

items.description: Block object belonging to a promotion.

link.description: The anchor text of the block object's link, if it has a link.

title.description: The block object's text, if it has text.

htmlTitle.description: The block object's text in HTML, if it has text.

url.description: The URL of the block object's link, if it has one.

displayLink.description: An abridged version of this search's result URL, e.g. www.example.com.

kind.description:
Unique identifier for the type of current object. For this API, it is
customsearch#search.

context.description:
Metadata and refinements associated with the given search engine,
including:

* The name of the search engine that was used for the query.

*   A set of [facet
objects](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/refinements#create)
(refinements) you can use for refining a search.

type.description:
The MIME type of the OpenSearch URL template for the Custom Search JSON
API.

searchTime.description: The time taken for the server to return search results.

formattedTotalResults.description: The total number of search results, formatted according to locale style.

formattedSearchTime.description:
The time taken for the server to return search results, formatted
according to locale style.

totalResults.description: The total number of search results returned by the query.

items.description: The current set of custom search results.

htmlCorrectedQuery.description: The corrected query, formatted in HTML.

spelling.description: Spell correction information for a query.

promotions.description:
The set of
[promotions](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/promotions).
Present only if the custom search engine's configuration files define any
promotions for the given query.

queries.description: Query metadata for the previous, current, and next pages of results.

orTerms.description:
Provides additional search terms to check for in a document, where each
document in the search results must contain at least one of the
additional search terms. You can also use the [Boolean
OR](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results#BooleanOrqt)
query term for this type of query.

safe.description:
Specifies the [SafeSearch
level](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results#safeSearchLevels)
used for filtering out adult results. This is a custom property not
defined in the OpenSearch spec. Valid parameter values are:

* `"off"`: Disable SafeSearch

* `"active"`: Enable SafeSearch

startPage.description:
The page number of this set of results, where the page length is set by
the `count` property.

dateRestrict.description:
Restricts results to URLs based on date. Supported values include:

* `d[number]`: requests results from the specified number of past days.

* `w[number]`: requests results from the specified number of past weeks.

* `m[number]`: requests results from the specified number of past months.

* `y[number]`: requests results from the specified number of past years.

hq.description:
Appends the specified query terms to the query, as if they were combined
with a logical `AND` operator.

linkSite.description: Specifies that all results should contain a link to a specific URL.

cr.description:
Restricts search results to documents originating in a particular
country. You may use [Boolean
operators](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results#booleanOperators)
in the `cr` parameter's value.

Google WebSearch determines the country of a document by analyzing the
following:

* The top-level domain (TLD) of the document's URL.

* The geographic location of the web server's IP address.

See [Country (cr) Parameter
Values](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results#countryCollections)
for a list of valid values for this parameter.

googleHost.description:
Specifies the Google domain (for example, google.com, google.de, or
google.fr) to which the search should be limited.

filter.description:
Activates or deactivates the automatic filtering of Google search
results. See [Automatic
Filtering](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results#automaticFiltering)
for more information about Google's search results filters. Valid values
for this parameter are:

* `0`: Disabled

* `1`: Enabled (default)

**Note**: By default, Google applies filtering to all search results to
improve the quality of those results.

startIndex.description:
The index of the current set of search results into the total set of
results, where the index of the first result is 1.

language.description: The language of the search results.

totalResults.description: Estimated number of total search results. May not be accurate.

imgType.description:
Restricts results to images of a specified type. Supported values are:

* `clipart` (Clip art)

* `face` (Face)

* `lineart` (Line drawing)

* `photo` (Photo)

* `animated` (Animated)

* `stock` (Stock)

hl.description:
Specifies the interface language (host language) of your user interface.
Explicitly setting this parameter improves the performance and the
quality of your search results.

See the [Interface
Languages](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results#wsInterfaceLanguages)
section of [Internationalizing Queries and Results
Presentation](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results#wsInternationalizing)
for more information, and [Supported Interface
Languages](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results_appendices#interfaceLanguages)
for a list of supported languages.

disableCnTwTranslation.description:
Enables or disables the [Simplified and Traditional Chinese
Search](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results#chineseSearch)
feature.

Supported values are:

* `0`: enabled (default)

* `1`: disabled

outputEncoding.description: The character encoding supported for search results.

fileType.description:
Restricts results to files of a specified extension. Filetypes supported
by Google include:

* Adobe Portable Document Format (`pdf`)

* Adobe PostScript (`ps`)

* Lotus 1-2-3 (`wk1`, `wk2`, `wk3`, `wk4`, `wk5`, `wki`, `wks`, `wku`)

* Lotus WordPro (`lwp`)

* Macwrite (`mw`)

* Microsoft Excel (`xls`)

* Microsoft PowerPoint (`ppt`)

* Microsoft Word (`doc`)

* Microsoft Works (`wks`, `wps`, `wdb`)

* Microsoft Write (`wri`)

* Rich Text Format (`rtf`)

* Shockwave Flash (`swf`)

* Text (`ans`, `txt`).

Additional filetypes may be added in the future. An up-to-date list can
always be found in Google's [file type
FAQ](https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/35287).

lowRange.description:
Specifies the starting value for a search range. Use `cse:lowRange` and
`cse:highrange` to append an inclusive search range of
`lowRange...highRange` to the query.

imgSize.description:
Restricts results to images of a specified size. Supported values are:

* `icon` (small)

* `small | medium | large | xlarge` (medium)

* `xxlarge` (large)

* `huge` (extra-large)

exactTerms.description:
Identifies a phrase that all documents in the search results must
contain.

gl.description:
Boosts search results whose country of origin matches the parameter
value. See [Country
Codes](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results#countryCodes)
for a list of valid values.

Specifying a `gl` parameter value in WebSearch requests should improve
the relevance of results. This is particularly true for international
customers and, even more specifically, for customers in English-speaking
countries other than the United States.

sort.description:
Specifies that results should be sorted according to the specified
expression. For example, sort by date.

highRange.description:
Specifies the ending value for a search range. Use `cse:lowRange` and
`cse:highrange` to append an inclusive search range of
`lowRange...highRange` to the query.

searchType.description:
Allowed values are `web` or `image`. If unspecified, results are limited
to webpages.

cx.description:
The identifier of an engine created using the Programmable Search Engine
[Control Panel](https://programmablesearchengine.google.com/). This is a
custom property not defined in the OpenSearch spec. This parameter is
**required**.

inputEncoding.description: The character encoding supported for search requests.

count.description: Number of search results returned in this set.

imgColorType.description:
Restricts results to images of a specified color type. Supported values
  are:

* `mono` (black and white)

* `gray` (grayscale)

* `color` (color)

siteSearchFilter.description:
Specifies whether to include or exclude results from the site named in
the `sitesearch` parameter. Supported values are:

* `i`: include content from site

* `e`: exclude content from site

excludeTerms.description:
Identifies a word or phrase that should not appear in any documents in
the search results.

searchTerms.description: The search terms entered by the user.

relatedSite.description:
Specifies that all search results should be pages that are related to the
specified URL. The parameter value should be a URL.

siteSearch.description: Restricts results to URLs from a specified site.

rights.description:
Filters based on licensing. Supported values include:

* `cc_publicdomain`

* `cc_attribute`

* `cc_sharealike`

* `cc_noncommercial`

* `cc_nonderived`

imgDominantColor.description:
Restricts results to images with a specific dominant color. Supported
values are:

* `red`

* `orange`

* `yellow`

* `green`

* `teal`

* `blue`

* `purple`

* `pink`

* `white`

* `gray`

* `black`

* `brown`

previousPage.description: Metadata representing the previous page of results, if applicable.

hl.description:
Specifies the interface language (host language) of your user interface.
Explicitly setting this parameter improves the performance and the
quality of your search results.

See the [Interface
Languages](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results#wsInterfaceLanguages)
section of [Internationalizing Queries and Results
Presentation](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results#wsInternationalizing)
for more information, and [Supported Interface
Languages](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results_appendices#interfaceLanguages)
for a list of supported languages.

filter.description:
Activates or deactivates the automatic filtering of Google search
results. See [Automatic
Filtering](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results#automaticFiltering)
for more information about Google's search results filters. Valid values
for this parameter are:

* `0`: Disabled

* `1`: Enabled (default)

**Note**: By default, Google applies filtering to all search results to
improve the quality of those results.

cx.description:
The identifier of an engine created using the Programmable Search Engine
[Control Panel](https://programmablesearchengine.google.com/). This is a
custom property not defined in the OpenSearch spec. This parameter is
**required**.

disableCnTwTranslation.description:
Enables or disables the [Simplified and Traditional Chinese
Search](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results#chineseSearch)
feature.

Supported values are:

* `0`: enabled (default)

* `1`: disabled

cr.description:
Restricts search results to documents originating in a particular
country. You may use [Boolean
operators](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results#booleanOperators)
in the `cr` parameter's value.

Google WebSearch determines the country of a document by analyzing the
following:

* The top-level domain (TLD) of the document's URL.

* The geographic location of the web server's IP address.

See [Country (cr) Parameter
Values](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results#countryCollections)
for a list of valid values for this parameter.

exactTerms.description:
Identifies a phrase that all documents in the search results must
contain.

orTerms.description:
Provides additional search terms to check for in a document, where each
document in the search results must contain at least one of the
additional search terms. You can also use the [Boolean
OR](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results#BooleanOrqt)
query term for this type of query.

imgSize.description:
Restricts results to images of a specified size. Supported values are:

* `icon` (small)

* `small | medium | large | xlarge` (medium)

* `xxlarge` (large)

* `huge` (extra-large)

searchTerms.description: The search terms entered by the user.

sort.description:
Specifies that results should be sorted according to the specified
expression. For example, sort by date.

count.description: Number of search results returned in this set.

imgColorType.description:
Restricts results to images of a specified color type. Supported values
  are:

* `mono` (black and white)

* `gray` (grayscale)

* `color` (color)

excludeTerms.description:
Identifies a word or phrase that should not appear in any documents in
the search results.

dateRestrict.description:
Restricts results to URLs based on date. Supported values include:

* `d[number]`: requests results from the specified number of past days.

* `w[number]`: requests results from the specified number of past weeks.

* `m[number]`: requests results from the specified number of past months.

* `y[number]`: requests results from the specified number of past years.

hq.description:
Appends the specified query terms to the query, as if they were combined
with a logical `AND` operator.

inputEncoding.description: The character encoding supported for search requests.

outputEncoding.description: The character encoding supported for search results.

imgType.description:
Restricts results to images of a specified type. Supported values are:

* `clipart` (Clip art)

* `face` (Face)

* `lineart` (Line drawing)

* `photo` (Photo)

* `animated` (Animated)

* `stock` (Stock)

startIndex.description:
The index of the current set of search results into the total set of
results, where the index of the first result is 1.

searchType.description:
Allowed values are `web` or `image`. If unspecified, results are limited
to webpages.

language.description: The language of the search results.

highRange.description:
Specifies the ending value for a search range. Use `cse:lowRange` and
`cse:highrange` to append an inclusive search range of
`lowRange...highRange` to the query.

totalResults.description: Estimated number of total search results. May not be accurate.

imgDominantColor.description:
Restricts results to images with a specific dominant color. Supported
values are:

* `red`

* `orange`

* `yellow`

* `green`

* `teal`

* `blue`

* `purple`

* `pink`

* `white`

* `gray`

* `black`

* `brown`

lowRange.description:
Specifies the starting value for a search range. Use `cse:lowRange` and
`cse:highrange` to append an inclusive search range of
`lowRange...highRange` to the query.

relatedSite.description:
Specifies that all search results should be pages that are related to the
specified URL. The parameter value should be a URL.

startPage.description:
The page number of this set of results, where the page length is set by
the `count` property.

gl.description:
Boosts search results whose country of origin matches the parameter
value. See [Country
Codes](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results#countryCodes)
for a list of valid values.

Specifying a `gl` parameter value in WebSearch requests should improve
the relevance of results. This is particularly true for international
customers and, even more specifically, for customers in English-speaking
countries other than the United States.

fileType.description:
Restricts results to files of a specified extension. Filetypes supported
by Google include:

* Adobe Portable Document Format (`pdf`)

* Adobe PostScript (`ps`)

* Lotus 1-2-3 (`wk1`, `wk2`, `wk3`, `wk4`, `wk5`, `wki`, `wks`, `wku`)

* Lotus WordPro (`lwp`)

* Macwrite (`mw`)

* Microsoft Excel (`xls`)

* Microsoft PowerPoint (`ppt`)

* Microsoft Word (`doc`)

* Microsoft Works (`wks`, `wps`, `wdb`)

* Microsoft Write (`wri`)

* Rich Text Format (`rtf`)

* Shockwave Flash (`swf`)

* Text (`ans`, `txt`).

Additional filetypes may be added in the future. An up-to-date list can
always be found in Google's [file type
FAQ](https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/35287).

rights.description:
Filters based on licensing. Supported values include:

* `cc_publicdomain`

* `cc_attribute`

* `cc_sharealike`

* `cc_noncommercial`

* `cc_nonderived`

linkSite.description: Specifies that all results should contain a link to a specific URL.

googleHost.description:
Specifies the Google domain (for example, google.com, google.de, or
google.fr) to which the search should be limited.

safe.description:
Specifies the [SafeSearch
level](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results#safeSearchLevels)
used for filtering out adult results. This is a custom property not
defined in the OpenSearch spec. Valid parameter values are:

* `"off"`: Disable SafeSearch

* `"active"`: Enable SafeSearch

siteSearchFilter.description:
Specifies whether to include or exclude results from the site named in
the `sitesearch` parameter. Supported values are:

* `i`: include content from site

* `e`: exclude content from site

siteSearch.description: Restricts results to URLs from a specified site.

nextPage.description: Metadata representing the next page of results, if applicable.

startIndex.description:
The index of the current set of search results into the total set of
results, where the index of the first result is 1.

siteSearchFilter.description:
Specifies whether to include or exclude results from the site named in
the `sitesearch` parameter. Supported values are:

* `i`: include content from site

* `e`: exclude content from site

imgColorType.description:
Restricts results to images of a specified color type. Supported values
  are:

* `mono` (black and white)

* `gray` (grayscale)

* `color` (color)

searchType.description:
Allowed values are `web` or `image`. If unspecified, results are limited
to webpages.

Identifies a phrase that all documents in the search results must
contain.

outputEncoding.description: The character encoding supported for search results.

relatedSite.description:
Specifies that all search results should be pages that are related to the
specified URL. The parameter value should be a URL.

searchTerms.description: The search terms entered by the user.

rights.description:
Filters based on licensing. Supported values include:

* `cc_publicdomain`

* `cc_attribute`

* `cc_sharealike`

* `cc_noncommercial`

* `cc_nonderived`

Specifies the starting value for a search range. Use `cse:lowRange` and
`cse:highrange` to append an inclusive search range of
`lowRange...highRange` to the query.

safe.description:

* `"active"`: Enable SafeSearch

* `white`

* `gray`

* `black`

* `brown`

* `lineart` (Line drawing)

* `stock` (Stock)

with a logical `AND` operator.

See [Country (cr) Parameter

highRange.description:
Specifies the ending value for a search range. Use `cse:lowRange` and

Restricts results to images of a specified size. Supported values are:

* `icon` (small)

* `small | medium | large | xlarge` (medium)

* `xxlarge` (large)

* `huge` (extra-large)

totalResults.description: Estimated number of total search results. May not be accurate.

startPage.description:
The page number of this set of results, where the page length is set by
the `count` property.

googleHost.description:
Specifies the Google domain (for example, google.com, google.de, or
google.fr) to which the search should be limited.

Activates or deactivates the automatic filtering of Google search
results. See [Automatic
Filtering](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results#automaticFiltering)
for more information about Google's search results filters. Valid values
for this parameter are:

* `0`: Disabled

**Note**: By default, Google applies filtering to all search results to
improve the quality of those results.

custom property not defined in the OpenSearch spec. This parameter is
**required**.

Specifying a `gl` parameter value in WebSearch requests should improve
the relevance of results. This is particularly true for international
customers and, even more specifically, for customers in English-speaking

dateRestrict.description:
Restricts results to URLs based on date. Supported values include:

* `d[number]`: requests results from the specified number of past days.

* `w[number]`: requests results from the specified number of past weeks.

* `m[number]`: requests results from the specified number of past months.

* `y[number]`: requests results from the specified number of past years.

sort.description:
Specifies that results should be sorted according to the specified
expression. For example, sort by date.

fileType.description:
Restricts results to files of a specified extension. Filetypes supported
by Google include:

* Adobe Portable Document Format (`pdf`)

* Adobe PostScript (`ps`)

* Lotus 1-2-3 (`wk1`, `wk2`, `wk3`, `wk4`, `wk5`, `wki`, `wks`, `wku`)

* Lotus WordPro (`lwp`)

* Macwrite (`mw`)

* Microsoft Excel (`xls`)

* Microsoft PowerPoint (`ppt`)

* Microsoft Word (`doc`)

* Microsoft Works (`wks`, `wps`, `wdb`)

* Microsoft Write (`wri`)

* Rich Text Format (`rtf`)

* Shockwave Flash (`swf`)

* Text (`ans`, `txt`).

Additional filetypes may be added in the future. An up-to-date list can
always be found in Google's [file type

orTerms.description:
Provides additional search terms to check for in a document, where each
document in the search results must contain at least one of the
additional search terms. You can also use the [Boolean
OR](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results#BooleanOrqt)
query term for this type of query.

linkSite.description: Specifies that all results should contain a link to a specific URL.

count.description: Number of search results returned in this set.

inputEncoding.description: The character encoding supported for search requests.

hl.description:
Specifies the interface language (host language) of your user interface.
Explicitly setting this parameter improves the performance and the
quality of your search results.

See the [Interface
Languages](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results#wsInterfaceLanguages)
section of [Internationalizing Queries and Results
Presentation](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results#wsInternationalizing)
for more information, and [Supported Interface
Languages](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results_appendices#interfaceLanguages)
for a list of supported languages.

siteSearch.description: Restricts results to URLs from a specified site.

disableCnTwTranslation.description:
Enables or disables the [Simplified and Traditional Chinese
Search](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/xml_results#chineseSearch)
feature.

Supported values are:

* `0`: enabled (default)

* `1`: disabled

Search.description: Response to a custom search request.

htmlSnippet.description: The snippet of the search result, in HTML.

cacheId.description: Indicates the ID of Google's cached version of the search result.

snippet.description: The snippet of the search result, in plain text.

htmlTitle.description: The title of the search result, in HTML.

kind.description:
A unique identifier for the type of current object. For this API, it is
`customsearch#result.`

fileFormat.description: The file format of the search result.

formattedUrl.description: The URL displayed after the snippet for each search result.

mime.description: The MIME type of the search result.

height.description: The height of the image, in pixels.

thumbnailLink.description: A URL to the thumbnail image.

thumbnailWidth.description: The width of the thumbnail image, in pixels.

contextLink.description: A URL pointing to the webpage hosting the image.

byteSize.description: The size of the image, in pixels.

width.description: The width of the image, in pixels.

thumbnailHeight.description: The height of the thumbnail image, in pixels.

image.description: Image belonging to a custom search result.

link.description:
The full URL to which the search result is pointing, e.g.
http://www.example.com/foo/bar.

title.description: The title of the search result, in plain text.

htmlFormattedUrl.description: The HTML-formatted URL displayed after the snippet for each search result.

items.description: Refinement label associated with a custom search result.

label_with_op.description: Refinement label and the associated refinement operation.

name.description:
The name of a refinement label, which you can use to refine searches.
Don't display this in your user interface; instead, use displayName.

displayName.description:
The display name of a refinement label. This is the name you should
display in your user interface.

displayLink.description: An abridged version of this search result’s URL, e.g. www.example.com.

pagemap.description:
Contains
[PageMap](https://developers.google.com/custom-search/docs/structured_data#pagemaps)
information for this search result.

name: customsearch
